meeting_annotations.speaker: Melanie Gareau
meeting_annotations.transcript: Well, in our with with our exorbitant mouse uh housing costs, they include surveillance. So what they do when they change the cages every two weeks is they'll take a handful of uh contents of the cage and put it in a recipient cage. So they take them from all over the varium and then they put them with nude mice, skid mice, which are immune compromised and then they'll measure they'll look at the microbiome in them and then they'll look at um evidence of infection with pathogens, things like that. You get a nice report quarterly. And so sometimes they pick up things like pin worms or other nasty things that then you have to re derive your colony and things like that. So that's how they survey.
